dt: {bc}a reply that indicates the withholding of assent {bc}{sx|refusal||}
{bc}a proposition which denies or contradicts another
{bc}the one of a pair of propositions in which {a_link|negation} is expressed
{bc}something that is the opposite or negation of something else
{bc}an expression (such as the word {it}no{/it}) of negation or denial
{bc}the side that upholds the contradictory proposition in a debate
{bc}a negative photographic image on transparent material used for printing positive pictures
{bc}the material that carries such an image
{bc}a reverse impression taken from a piece of sculpture or ceramics
{bc}with a negative reply {bc}with a reply that means "no"

et: Middle English {it}negatif{/it} "negative command, prohibition," borrowed from Anglo-French & Late Latin; Anglo-French {it}negative,{/it} borrowed from Late Latin {it}negātīva{/it} "negative command or statement," from feminine of Latin {it}negātīvus{/it} "(of legal actions) restraining, (of words) denying" {ma}{mat|negative:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a reply that indicates the withholding of assent : refusal

dt: {bc}to reject by or as if by a vote
{bc}to deny the truth, reality, or validity of

shortdef: to reject by or as if by a vote

dt: {bc}a now nonstandard syntactic construction containing two negatives and having a negative meaning

dt.t: "I didn't hear nothing" is a {it}double negative{/it}

shortdef: a now nonstandard syntactic construction containing two negatives and having a negative meaning

dt: {bc}a person or test result that is incorrectly classified as negative (as for the presence of a health condition) because of imperfect testing methods or procedures

dt.t: A {wi}false negative{/wi}, in medical lingo, is a screening test that says "no cancer" when all the while a cancer is, in fact, growing undetected.

dt: often hyphenated when used before another noun

dt.t: … only 4 of 31 tears found on arthroscopic evaluation were missed prospectively by MRI, and two of these {wi}false-negative{/wi} results were found retrospectively to be due to observer error rather than failure of the MRI system to image the tear.

shortdef: a person or test result that is incorrectly classified as negative (as for the presence of a health condition) because of imperfect testing methods or procedures —often hyphenated when used before another noun
